workflow.name: Generate AI-powered end-of-day reports from ClickUp & GoHighLevel to multi-channel
workflow.description:
## Description
Automatically generate and distribute detailed End-of-Day (EOD) reports combining task progress from ClickUp and opportunity data from GoHighLevel. This workflow uses AI to analyze daily performance, summarize key metrics, identify blockers, and deliver polished reports directly to Slack, Email, and Google Drive. âš™ï¸ğŸ“ŠğŸ’¬

## What This Template Does
- Triggers automatically every weekday at 6:00 PM (Monâ€“Fri). â°
- Fetches all completed ClickUp tasks and won GoHighLevel opportunities for the day. ğŸ“¥
- Merges and transforms both datasets into a unified structure. ğŸ”„
- Uses Azure OpenAI GPT-4 to analyze performance and generate structured summaries. ğŸ¤–
- Formats three output versions â€” Slack (Markdown), Email (HTML), and Google Drive (Text). ğŸ§¾
- Routes and sends reports automatically to connected channels. ğŸ“¤
- Uploads the generated text report to Google Drive with timestamped filenames. â˜ï¸

## Key Benefits
âœ… Saves time by automating daily performance reporting.
 âœ… Unifies task and deal data into a single AI-generated summary.
 âœ… Provides real-time visibility into productivity and outcomes.
 âœ… Delivers beautifully formatted, channel-specific reports.
 âœ… Maintains historical reports in Google Drive for reference.
 âœ… Helps managers identify wins, blockers, and next steps quickly.

## Features
- Automated scheduling via cron (Monâ€“Fri, 6 PM).
- ClickUp task and GHL opportunity integration for daily data sync.
- AI-powered analysis for contextual, actionable summaries.
- Dynamic formatting for Slack, Email, and Drive outputs.
- Parallel routing for simultaneous delivery across platforms.
- No manual steps â€” runs fully hands-free after setup.

## Requirements
- ClickUp OAuth2 credentials for task retrieval.
- GoHighLevel OAuth2 credentials for deal data.
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4 API credentials.
- Slack Bot credentials for message posting.
- SMTP (Gmail/Outlook) credentials for email reports.
- Google Drive OAuth2 credentials for report upload.

## Target Audience
ğŸ¯ Sales, marketing, and operations teams tracking daily performance.
 ğŸ“ˆ Project managers monitoring team productivity and blockers.
 ğŸ¤ Client success teams summarizing EOD outcomes for leadership.
 ğŸ§  Business automation teams seeking end-of-day visibility.

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect ClickUp, GoHighLevel, Slack, Gmail/SMTP, and Google Drive credentials. ğŸ”‘
- Set your team, space, folder, and list IDs in the ClickUp node. ğŸ“‹
- Update your Slack channel ID in the Slack node configuration. ğŸ’¬
- Configure your email sender and recipients in the email node. ğŸ“§
- (Optional) Modify the cron expression for different reporting times. â°
- Test the workflow manually once, then activate for automated EOD execution. âœ…

workflow.name: Automate End-of-Day Report Generation from ClickUp and GoHighLevel to Slack, Email, and Google Drive

parameters.content:
## ğŸ“Š Automate End-of-Day Report Generation from ClickUp and GoHighLevel to Slack, Email, and Google Drive 

This workflow automatically generates comprehensive End-of-Day (EOD) reports by:
- Fetching tasks from ClickUp
- Retrieving opportunities from GoHighLevel (GHL)
- Merging and transforming data into a unified format
- Using AI to analyze and generate insightful reports
- Distributing reports via Slack, Email, and Google Drive

### ğŸ¯ Use Case
Perfect for teams wanting automated daily summaries of:
- Task completions and blockers
- Sales pipeline progress
- Team performance metrics
- Action items for tomorrow

### â° Schedule
Runs Monday-Friday at 6:00 PM (18:00)

### ğŸ”§ Setup Requirements
1. ClickUp OAuth2 credentials
2. GoHighLevel OAuth2 credentials
3. Azure OpenAI API credentials
4. Slack API credentials
5. SMTP credentials for email
6. Google Drive OAuth2 credentials

## â° Step 1: Schedule Trigger

**Cron Expression:** `0 18 * * 1-5`
- Runs at 6:00 PM (18:00)
- Monday through Friday only
- Timezone: Server default

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Click this node
2. Adjust time if needed using cron expression
3. Test manually using "Execute Node" button

## ğŸ“‹ Step 2: Fetch ClickUp Tasks

**What it does:**
Retrieves tasks from your ClickUp workspace for the current day.

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Connect ClickUp OAuth2 credentials
2. Replace these IDs with your own:
   - Team ID (get from ClickUp workspace URL)
   - Space ID (from space settings)
   - Folder ID (from folder URL)
   - List ID (from list URL)

**Filters Applied:**
- Due date: Today
- Includes subtasks

**Security:** Remove hardcoded IDs before sharing!

## ğŸ’¼ Step 3: Fetch GHL Opportunities

**What it does:**
Retrieves won opportunities from GoHighLevel CRM.

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Connect GoHighLevel OAuth2 credentials
2. Adjust filters if needed:
   - Current: Only "won" opportunities
   - Optional: Add date range filters

**Limit:** 100 opportunities

**Security:** Credentials are stored securely in n8n

## ğŸ”€ Step 4: Merge Data Sources

**What it does:**
Combines ClickUp tasks and GHL opportunities into a single dataset.

**Merge Strategy:**
- Input 1: ClickUp tasks
- Input 2: GHL opportunities
- Mode: Append (combines all items)

**No configuration needed** - just ensure both data sources connect here.

## ğŸ”„ Step 5: Transform & Structure Data

**What it does:**
Transforms merged data into a unified format for AI analysis.

**Key Transformations:**
- Maps ClickUp tasks â†’ GHL opportunity format
- Extracts monetary values from custom fields
- Normalizes status values
- Aggregates summary statistics

**Output Structure:**
- Total items count
- Opportunities array
- Summary metrics (by status, source, total value)

**No configuration needed** - transformation logic is built-in.

## ğŸ¤– Step 6: AI Report Generation

**What it does:**
Uses Azure OpenAI GPT-4o to analyze data and generate structured EOD report.

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Connect Azure OpenAI credentials
2. Model: GPT-4o (recommended)
3. Memory: 7-message window for context

**AI Analysis Includes:**
- Brief summary
- Key wins
- Important metrics
- Blockers/issues
- Action items for tomorrow

**Output:** Structured JSON matching defined schema

## ğŸ“¤ Step 7: Format for Distribution

**What it does:**
Creates three formatted versions of the report:
1. **Slack**: Markdown with emojis
2. **Email**: HTML with styling
3. **Google Drive**: Plain text file

**Each Output Contains:**
- Title
- Summary
- Wins
- Key metrics
- Blockers
- Action items
- Timestamp

**No configuration needed** - automatic routing.

## ğŸ”€ Step 8: Route to Channels

**What it does:**
Three parallel IF nodes route data to appropriate channels.

**Routing Logic:**
- `type = "slack"` â†’ Slack node
- `type = "email"` â†’ Email node
- `type = "google_drive"` â†’ Google Drive node

**All three routes execute in parallel** for simultaneous delivery.

**No configuration needed** - automatic based on data type.

## ğŸ’¬ Step 9A: Send to Slack

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Connect Slack OAuth2 credentials
2. **IMPORTANT:** Replace channel ID with your own:
   - Get from: Slack â†’ Right-click channel â†’ Copy link
   - Extract: Last part of URL (e.g., C09GNB90TED)
3. Select channel from dropdown

**Message Format:**
- Title with icon
- Markdown formatting
- All report sections

## ğŸ“§ Step 9B: Send Email

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Connect SMTP credentials (Gmail, Outlook, etc.)
2. **IMPORTANT:** Replace these placeholders:
   - `fromEmail`: Your company email
   - `toEmail`: Recipient(s) email
3. Customize subject line if needed

**Email Features:**
- Professional HTML template
- Gradient header
- Color-coded sections
- Mobile-responsive design

## ğŸ“ Step 9C: Upload to Google Drive

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Connect Google Drive OAuth2 credentials
2. Select destination folder:
   - Default: Root folder
   - Recommended: Create "EOD Reports" folder
3. Filename format: `EOD_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.txt`

**File Content:**
- Plain text with ASCII art borders
- All report sections
- Timestamp

**Security:** Folder ID is safe to share (no personal data)

parameters.subject: ={{ $json.subject }}

parameters.text:
=You are given the following aggregated End-of-Day data from ClickUp (task management) and GHL (sales pipeline):

{{ JSON.stringify($json.opportunities || $json, null, 2) }}

Please analyze this data and generate a structured End-of-Day (EOD) summary report.

**Analysis Guidelines:**

**For ClickUp Tasks:**
- Count tasks by status (complete, in progress, blocked, etc.)
- Calculate total time spent across all tasks
- Identify completed tasks as wins
- Flag blocked or delayed tasks as blockers
- Note team members with completed work

**For GHL Opportunities:**
- Count opportunities by status (won, open, lost, abandoned)
- Sum total monetary value of won deals
- Identify new opportunities created today
- Note high-value deals in progress
- Track conversion rates if applicable

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert executive assistant AI specialized in creating comprehensive End-of-Day (EOD) summary reports.

Your task is to analyze aggregated data from two systems:
1. **ClickUp Tasks**: Project management tasks with status, assignees, time tracking, and completion details
2. **GHL Opportunities**: Sales pipeline data with deals, monetary values, stages, and contact information

**Your responsibilities:**
- Analyze the combined data from both systems
- Extract key metrics, wins, blockers, and action items
- Identify patterns and trends across tasks and opportunities
- Highlight team member contributions and achievements
- Flag any issues or blockers that need attention
- Provide actionable next steps

**Output Requirements:**
- Structure your response as valid JSON matching the provided schema
- Be concise, professional, and actionable
- Use specific numbers and metrics from the data
- Focus on insights, not just data repetition
- Ensure all arrays contain strings, not objects
- Keep each item brief (1-2 sentences maximum)

**Data Structure:**
- ClickUp tasks will have fields like: id, name, status, assignees, time_spent, date_created, date_updated, project
- GHL opportunities will have fields like: id, name, monetaryValue, status, pipelineStageId, contact, source

Generate a comprehensive but concise EOD report based on this combined dataset.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
